body:
After #49801, #49808 and https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-fs-util/pull/60, Quarkus should now set fixed timestamps for ZIP entries (and file permissions as well) when building Gradle projects, but:

- When using Gradle 9+, no extra configuration is needed.
- When using Gradle 8.x, you need these configurations:

```
tasks.withType<AbstractArchiveTask>().configureEach {
    isPreserveFileTimestamps = false
    isReproducibleFileOrder = true
}
```

Try that without the custom Gradle code. No idea about the duplicated entries though.

---

Edit:

Ah, nvm, I just saw your PR: https://github.com/apache/polaris/pull/2667

@Eng-Fouad Yea - there's also [this piece](https://github.com/apache/polaris/blob/2c0bf583adf250e2a38cde03ed407940dcaf3d8a/build-logic/src/main/kotlin/polaris-reproducible.gradle.kts) pulled in by all projects. But that doesn't apply to the mentioned jars, which are generated by Quarkus, not Gradle.

I confirm I can reproduce the issue even with a simple Maven project:

```
     6250  09-25-2025 09:25   io/quarkus/vertx/http/runtime/ServerLimitsConfig$$CMImpl.class
     6250  09-25-2025 09:25   io/quarkus/vertx/http/runtime/ServerLimitsConfig$$CMImpl.class
```

Note all entries are duplicated, which is extremely odd.

I'm not sure exactly why yet but we are generating some of the config classes several times:

```
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.AuthRuntimeConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.BodyConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.CertificateConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.cors.CORSConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.FilterConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.FormAuthConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.HeaderConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.MultiPartConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.ProxyConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.ServerLimitsConfig$$CMImpl
      2 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.ServerSslConfig$$CMImpl
      3 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.PolicyConfig$$CMImpl
      3 Generated resource: io.quarkus.vertx.http.runtime.PolicyMappingConfig$$CMImpl
```

The previous implementation was deduplicating them by accident. This is not the case anymore.

issue.title: Config - Avoid producing duplicate GeneratedClassBuildItem

labels.name: area/spring
labels.description: Issues relating to the Spring integration

issue.body:
Also guard against it in the Jar generation to make sure we don't end up with duplicate entries.

Fixes #50265

body: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/50278 fixes it, thanks for the detailed report.

> [@Eng-Fouad](https://github.com/Eng-Fouad) Yea - there's also [this piece](https://github.com/apache/polaris/blob/2c0bf583adf250e2a38cde03ed407940dcaf3d8a/build-logic/src/main/kotlin/polaris-reproducible.gradle.kts) pulled in by all projects. But that doesn't apply to the mentioned jars, which are generated by Quarkus, not Gradle.

`isPreserveFileTimestamps` is being used by Quarkus.

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/eb0b616f9cede7905364e925b43b7b25b3f10ab1/devtools/gradle/gradle-application-plugin/src/main/java/io/quarkus/gradle/tasks/QuarkusBuildTask.java#L70
